segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye … pe …
segments.en: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana. …

segments.pli: “Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “What’s the cause, reverend, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Rūpe kho, āvuso, avigatarāgassa avigatacchandassa avigatapemassa avigatapipāsassa avigatapariḷāhassa avigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: “Reverend, if you’re not rid of greed, desire, fondness, thirst, passion, and craving for form …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
viññāṇe avigatarāgassa avigatacchandassa avigatapemassa avigatapipāsassa avigatapariḷāhassa avigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: consciousness, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Rūpe ca kho, āvuso, vigatarāgassa … pe …
segments.en: If you are rid of greed for form …

segments.pli: viññāṇe vigatarāgassa vigatacchandassa vigatapemassa vigatapipāsassa vigatapariḷāhassa vigatataṇhassa ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: consciousness, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were…

suttaplex.blurb: Mahākoṭṭhita asks Sāriputta whether a Realized One exists after death. Sāriputta says that only someone who has desire for the five aggregates would think in such terms.
